addToBagError: Error adding analyses to your bag
analysesDeleteError: Unable to delete analyses. Please try again.
analysesExecDeleteWarning: This will permanently remove the selected analysis and the parameters information associated with the analysis. Outputs can still be viewed in the folder created by the analysis in your Data view.
analysesExecDeleteWarning_plural: This will permanently remove the selected analyses and the parameters information associated with the analyses. Outputs can still be viewed in the folders created by the analyses in your Data view.
analysesMultiRelaunchWarning: Relaunching more than one analysis at once will relaunch all selected analyses, reusing their original parameters and analysis names. If the selected analyses are sub-jobs of an HT analysis, then those selected analyses will still be nested under that parent HT analysis, and their output folders will also be grouped under that parent HT analysis' output folder, but the relaunched sub-jobs will be renamed with a `-redo-#` suffix to differentiate them from their original sub-jobs. Otherwise, relaunched analyses will be treated as new analyses, even though they reuse the same name and parameters as their original analyses.
analysesRelaunchError: Unable to relaunch analyses. Please try again.
analysisCancelError: Unable to stop execution of analysis. Please try again.
analysisCancelError_plural: 1 or more analyses could not be stopped. Please try again.
analysisCommentError: Unable to update analysis comments. Please try again.
analysisInfoFetchError: Unable to fetch analysis information. Please try again.
analysisParamFetchError: Unable to fetch analysis parameters. Please try again.
analysisRenameError: Unable to rename analysis. Please try again.
errorCheckingInputStat: Error checking the status of this input.
errorInputDoesNotExist: The input file/folder no longer exists at that location: {{path}}
extendTimeLimitMessage: This analysis is scheduled to be terminated at {{timeLimit}}. Do you wish to extend the time limit?
jobLogsUnavailableMessage: The logs will be available within the analysis output folder after the status of this analysis changes to Completed or Failed.
landingPageFootNote: * This page will refresh automatically. * You can bookmark this page to come back to it later.
name: Name
pendingTerminationMessage: {{name}} is still in the {{ status }} state. The output files/folders will become available when this analysis reaches one of the following statuses: {{ terminalStates }}.
statusHelpAppProblem:
Problem with app:
  • If the app is public: Please post a comment.
  • If the app is private: Validate with several real datasets. Contact the original author of the tool.
statusHelpCompletedNoOutput: If there are only log files, the application did not run successfully. Check your log files (condor-stderr-0 and condor-stdout-0) under the logs directory. If you see the message similar to input file not found, the cause could be due to:
statusHelpCompletedUnexpectedOutput: If your output files did not return expected results:
statusHelpCondorRunning:
• Is the input consistent with the intended functionality of the app? Please read the app manual for limits on the size of input files an app can normally handle and an estimate of how long it should take for your analysis to complete.
  • If you are trying to run an analysis with input that is much larger than the app can handle, it may not complete. Do not try to relaunch this analysis. If you would like to suggest a new app for additional functionality, please contact support.
statusHelpCondorSubmitted: Your analysis is submitted and is queued for running. You may experience long wait times for analysis submissions after maintenance or periods of peak demand. Please allow 24 hours for your analysis to start running.
statusHelpCorruptedInput: Corrupted input file: Try to run the app again using another input file. Start with the example file supplied with the app. You may need to return to your original data source (e.g. sequencing center) and request a new copy of the input data.
statusHelpFailed:
There are several common causes for a failed analysis.

When there is a scheduled DE maintenance, all submitted analyses will be killed. If your analysis fails on a maintenance day, please relaunch the analysis.

Problem with the input file(s):
statusHelpFailedOtherReasons: Other common reasons for analysis failure:
statusHelpInputFileFormat: Incorrect input file format: Read the app manual, reformat the input file, and relaunch.
statusHelpInvalidParameters: Invalid parameters: Each tool will report errors differently. You will need to check the log files for an error message. Start by checking the ‘condor_stderr’ file which lists all the errors encountered by the tool, and the ‘condor_stdout’ file which lists all of the output from the tool. Also check the app documentation, including the original documentation for the tool.
statusHelpNoOutput: Analysis completed but I got no output.
statusHelpShareDisclaimer: I agree to <shareLink>share my analysis</shareLink> details, output file(s) and logs with CyVerse Support. If you want any of the <sciInformaticiansLink>Science Informaticians</sciInformaticiansLink> to recuse themselves from assisting with this problem, please list their name(s) in comments.
statusHelpShareError: An error was encountered while attempting to share with support. Please try again or contact support for assistance.
statusHelpShareSuccess: Your support request is submitted. A support staff will contact you shortly.
statusHelpSpecialChars: Special characters in the file name: Rename the file, excluding any of the special characters, and relaunch the analysis.
statusHelpSubmittedHeader: My analysis has been in the Submitted state for a long time.
statusHelpTapisRunning: HPC apps that use the Tapis API will display as "Running" while the data is being transferred. If your analysis has a very large input file or output file, part of the run time may be due to data transfer. Certain apps have very long run times, depending on the input. Please check the app documentation to estimate how long you it should take for your analysis to complete.
statusHelpTapisSubmitted: This application runs on XSEDE, the U.S. national supercomputing network. Wait time for your analysis to submit and run may be up to several days. Please do not resubmit your analysis. See accessing <xsede>XSEDE</xsede> and queues for more information.
statusHelpUnexpectedOutput: Analysis completed but I got unexpected output.
terminateAnalysisMessage: This will end the selected running analysis even if it hasn't completed. Outputs will be saved and when ready, can be viewed in the folder created by the analysis in your Data view.
terminateAnalysisMessage_plural: This will end the selected running analyses even if they haven't completed. Outputs will be saved and when ready, can be viewed in the folders created by the analyses in your Data view.
timeLimitError: Unable to get the current time limit. Please try again.
timeLimitExtended: Time limit for {{analysisName}} has been extended. This analysis will end on {{newTimeLimit}}
viceLogsFetchError: Unable to fetch logs for this analysis. Please try again.
